entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding, with the worst conditions expected from the Kenai Lake to Funny River. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Wednesday.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 22 at 6:06AM PDT until August 22 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ACROSS EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... .A disturbance moving crossing the area is expected to produce isolated to scattered thunderstorms over the eastern mountain zones through this afternoon. Abundant lightning is expected over the Blue Mountains and Wallowa County.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Blue Mountains of Washington; Southeast Washington Grande Ronde Valley

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 22 at 4:38AM PDT until August 22 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Thunderstorm chances will increase over southeast Washington this morning. This will carry the potential for abundant lightning with limited moisture. This will increase the potential for fire starts. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR ABUNDANT LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE WAZ709...
